body_html: Personally, I'm a very big fan of the feed_dict method of feeding data into the graph. It is by far the most flexible, makes debugging way easier and makes for much simpler code. Thus my biggest wish would be to make that method more performant. Right now, this method starves my GPU all the time, which is a shame because most other DL frameworks (even those based on computational graphs) manage to make this much more performantly. I assume there is more copying/handling going on in the background than would be necessary.

body: Personally, I'm a very big fan of the `feed_dict` method of feeding data into the graph. It is by far the most flexible, makes debugging way easier and makes for much simpler code. Thus my biggest wish would be to make that method more performant. Right now, this method starves my GPU all the time, which is a shame because most other DL frameworks (even those based on computational graphs) manage to make this much more performantly. I assume there is more copying/handling going on in the background than would be necessary.
